Title: "Advanced Hotel Search: Filters, Ratings, and Locations"
Text:
C:\Users\adamh\Downloads\azure-search.pdf0) and Rating ge 4    $filter=HotelName ne 'Sea View Motel' and LastRenovationDate ge 2010-01-01T00:00:00Z    $filter=LastRenovationDate ge 2010-01-01T00:00:00-08:00    $filter=ParkingIncluded and Rooms/all(room:
not room/SmokingAllowed)odata-filter-exprFind all hotels that are Luxury or include parking and have a rating of 5:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with the tag "wifi" in at least one room (where each room has tags storedin a Collection(Edm.
String) field):odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with any rooms:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels that don't have rooms:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels within 10 kilometers of a given reference point (where Location is a fieldof type Edm.GeographyPoint):odata-filter-exprFind all hotels within a given viewport described as a polygon (where Location is a fieldof type Edm.GeographyPoint). The polygon must be closed, meaning the first and lastpoint sets must be the same. Also, the points must be listed in counterclockwise order.
$filter=ParkingIncluded eq true and Rooms/all(room: room/SmokingAllowed eq false)    $filter=(Category eq 'Luxury' or ParkingIncluded eq true) and Rating eq 5    $filter=Rooms/any(room: room/Tags/any(tag: tag eq 'wifi'))    $filter=Rooms/any()    $filter=not Rooms/any()    $filter=geo.distance(Location, geography'POINT(-122. 131577 47.678581)') le 10odata-filter-exprFind all hotels where the "Description" field is null. The field will be null if it was neverset, or if it was explicitly set to null:odata-filter-exprFind all hotels with name equal to either 'Sea View motel' or 'Budget hotel'). Thesephrases contain spaces, and space is a default delimiter.
